dialog: All those in favorâ¦ All opposed.
Well, the PTA has an accepted set of rules concerning the prom.
Young ladies must wear nonrevealing dresses.
Young men must wear suits or tuxes.
And if a student chooses to bring a date, they must be of the opposite sex.
Well, can't you just ban this student?
Well, we've been advised that there may be some legal repercussions if we prevent this girl from attending, so although it breaks my heart, we have no choice.
Have you asked the students what they think of this?
Are you choosing not to comment?
Emma, what do you think of the PTA's decision to cancel prom?
Emma, do you have a response?
It's Frank DiLella with New York 1's On Stage.
We're here for the opening night of Eleanor! The Eleanor Roosevelt Musical, starring the incomparable Dee Dee Allen.
Dee Dee! You're a Broadway star.
You have your choice of roles.
Well, Eleanor Roosevelt was a brave, powerful, charismatic woman who no one had ever heard of.
Her story needs to be told.
People need to know it is possible to change the world, whether you're a homely middleaged First Lady or a Broadway star!
Barry Glickman! You were brilliant as FDR.
From the moment I first stepped into FDR's shoesâ¦ And when I say "shoes," I mean wheelchair.
I realized there is no difference between the president of the United States and a celebrity.
The power to change the world.

âª When I'm in character, I go insane âª âª I stagger, I stammer, I sob âª âª I make the audiences feel my pain âª âª And if they don't leave depressed Then I've not done my job âª âª Each time I find a role like Eleanor âª âª The artist inside of me thrives âª âª I put on that wig And those prosthetic teeth âª âª And know I'm changing lives âª âª By the time I get tuberculosis In act two âª âª Even the people who are dead inside âª âª Will shout, "Bravo," on cue! âª Bravo!
Don't tell meâ¦ unless it's a rave or a mixedpositive.
âª We're a hit and I think we deserve it âª âª That's for sure âª âª Also, it means that this tour de force âª âª Will not be forced to tour âª To Eleanor!

âª Cheers to a show that's so inspiring âª âª It's almost too much to sit through âª âª And if we run That might mean one more thing âª âª That in ten years or so âª âª We'll do Eleanor Two! âª âª I can predict What the reviews will say âª âª Before the next notice arrives âª âª It's groundbreaking âª  âª Earthshaking! âª  âª Lifeaffirming! âª  âª Breathtaking âª  âª Gutwrenching! âª  âª Heartaching âª  âª In two words, it's historymaking âª âª That's why every actor strives âª âª For adulation âª âª And compensation âª âª That comes from nightly âª âª Changing lives! âª It's just what we do.
The rest of the reviews are coming in!
New York Post, Associated Press, New York Times.
This is not a review you want when you have crappy advance sales.
What didn't they like? Was it the hiphop?
For God's sake, Sheldon. Just read it.
"Barry Glickman's FDR might just be the most insultingly misguided, offensive, and laughable performance that this reviewer has ever had the squirming misfortune to endure." That's not so bad.

"Watching Dee Dee Allen's Eleanor Roosevelt croaking out a heavyhanded message of activism is like paying an aging drag queen to shove a syrupsoaked American flag down my throat." Well, thatâ¦ That's not criticism.
That's justâ¦ It's just a perâ¦ â¦a personal attack.
"If you're considering buying a ticket to this show, do yourself a favor." "Buy a few feet of good, heavy rope instead and then go hang yourself." Oh, God! Oh, God!
Was the show really that bad?
It's not the show. It's you two.
Leave it to me. I'll go and try and change the narrative once again.
I hate this world! This is bullshit!
Just horrible. It's justâ¦ It hurts.
Uh, ohâ¦  We've done five shows together.
Oh, right, Trent! Of course, Trent!
Why are you dressed like a waiter?
I'm in between gigs at the moment.
Honestly, Dee Dee, I feel adrift as I did in my days before Juilliard.
You see, my passions are fueled by the power of Lady Theater and how she can, with a gentle touch of her hand, sculpt a human soul.
But we learned at Juilliardâ¦  Oh, mother of God.
If I could soliloquize, "If you prick me, do I not bleed?" "And if you do not pay me, do I not still act?" That might be enough.
Still, I have played Hamlet, and yet I'm only known as that guy from the beloved early aughts' sitcomâ¦ Talk to the Hand.
I question the very meaning of my existence.
Maggie Smith once approached me in a men's bathroom and she said, "Who sent you? Was it Michelle Dockery?" "Because the court said 500 yards." You could tell she was scared.
I'm sorry your show closed on opening night again!
Welcome to the world of the unemployed. Top me off.
I thought you were in Chicago.
Twenty years in the chorus and they still wouldn't let me play Roxie Hart.
You wanna know who's playing the role?
Oh, my God, is she still alive?
At least we're all in the same boat.
"Misery acquaints a man with strange bedfellows."  Oh, my God.
Two, I refuse to give up, okay?
Now, The Times sort of castrated you as it were.
Yep. They wrote you off as aging narcissists.
I still don't understand what's wrong with that.
There's a very simple way that we can still love ourselves yet appear to be decent human beings, okay?
All we need is a cause.
Everybody think of some causes. Go.
That is also a major thing.
No, we need something we can handle.
Some little injustice we can drive to. Recycling.
Why are there so many award shows?
Or the TVs in the back of cabs.
Oh! Oh, yeah, what about this girl?
Oh, my gosh. Check this out.
She's a lesbian. She wanted to take her girlfriend to the high school prom, and the PTA went apeshit and they canceled it.
Are they allowed to do that?
The first thing I'm going to do is contact the Indiana state's attorney.
This is not about school rules.
This is a civil rights case.
I'm betting pressure from the state's attorney will stop these bigots cold.
Because I'll tell you this much.
If word gets out, people are gonna get mad.
The next thing you know, some modernday Eleanor Roosevelt is gonna march down here and all hell's gonna break loose.
We have got to go down there and raise holy hell.
We will be the biggest thing to happen in Indiana sinceâ¦ whatever's happened in Indiana.
So this is it? This is our cause?
We'll get Sheldon to tag along.
He can find us a venue.
You bet your sweet MILF ass we can!

We are gonna proveâ¦ âª That in this day and age âª âª Being gay isn't a crime âª âª This is our moment to change the world âª  âª One lesbianâ¦ âª  âª Lesbian âª  âª Lesbian âª  âª Lesbian âª âª At a time! âª âª We're gonna help that little lesbian âª âª Whether she likes it or not âª âª When you're a legendary thespian âª âª First, you help the distressed âª âª Then you help the distraught âª âª We're going down To where the necks are red âª âª And lack of dentistry thrives âª âª Why sing and dance When you can take a stance! âª âª And know you're truly changing lives âª Okay, now we have got to get an anthem!
Like "We Are The World."  Yes, but for lesbians.
He's a big fan of my Sweeney Todd.
Wait. How are we gonna get there?
I just booked a nonunion tour of Godspell and it goes straight through Indiana.
You can come with us on the bus.

Yeah, you know, I'm pretty sure this breaks a few laws.
It's our way of saying thank you, Emma.
I didn't cancel prom. Your parents did.
Oh, are you on her side now?
I'm just not in third grade.
Unlike your social life, this isn't over.

Hey, who's this girl you were gonna bring to the prom, anyway?
I didn't know we had more than one lesbo in town.
You don't know her. She's new here.
Well, then why don't you, like, exchange her for a guy?

She thinks this is a civil rights issue.
This is a big deal, Emma.
I'm just saying I'm really excited to be a part of something like this.
We'll see how the PTA meeting goes.
Well, it's not gonna be fun.

How about we do some trust exercises?
Hotel is booked. Breakfast isn't included, but there is a Waffle Shed next door.
We're doing a great thing here.
This is gonna get me my third Tony Award.
Oh, come on, you know how political the Tonys are.
My brand is a little tarnished at the moment.
'Cause of the infamous tirade at the Longacre Theatre?
When a cell phone goes off in the middle of a performanceâ¦  I can't be held responsible.
I didn't know that at the time. Anywayâ¦ All the goodwill that we're gonna get from this thing will wash me clean, and I will win, no matter what my next project is.
I'd be happy with one Tony.
I thought I had a shot with FDR.
I'm so sick of all the rejection.
No, I mean Trent. He's retching again.

You were saying something about yourâ¦ I got into this business, yes, because I loved it, but also to prove to everyone who doubted me, myâ¦ teachers, the kids on the school bus, my horrible parents, that I could do something.
That's exactly what we are doing.
I just hope we don't screw it up.

âª Day by dayâ¦ âª âª Day by day âª âª Day by day âª âª Three things I pray âª âª Three things I pray âª I'm sorry, you're telling us that the state's attorney is forcing us to have a prom?
No, the state's attorney wants us to hold an inclusive prom.
Because that's what they feel best reflects America's values.
Well, this isn't America. This is Indiana.
Just to be clear, this is America and everyone gets to have an opinion...
My son will not be forced to go to a homosexual prom.
Again, it is not a homosexual prom.
It is an inclusive promâ¦  With homosexuals.
You don't have to attend if you don't want to.
Lookâ¦ Iâ¦ I'm sorry you're upset, but the organization of the prom is within the purview of the student council.
Let's hear what they have to say. Alyssa?
Well, we want prom to go on, obviously.
It's supposed to be a celebration of all students...
Okay. No, thank you. It's fine, everyone.
Sweetheart, I'm so sorry, but this is not a student matter.
This is about governmentâ¦ tearing our community apart.
It's about big government taking away our freedom of choice.
This is not about government intervention.
I just want to go to prom like any other kid.
She can't, and that's why the courts are involved.
What exactly is it that you find so frightening about gay people?
What you are doing here is wrong.
Where is our girl? Where's Emma? Emma!
Emma, my name is Barry, and I'm here to tell you that you are not alone.
Okay? I am as gay as a bucket of wigs.
And we are here from New York City and we are gonna save you.
Tomorrow, we will hold a rally.
What is going on? Who are you people?
We are here to open your hearts and your minds.
The five of us are gonna teach youâ¦  Where's Dee Dee?
Oh, my God. That's Dee Dee Allen.

Was it you?
Me? No, I have no idea what just happened in there.
Strangers burst in hurling insults at the parents, and you do nothing.
What kind of school are you running here, Mr. Hawkins?
I am the principal and I just, umâ¦ What are you doing?
We have come to show this community that gay people and gaypositive icons, such as myself, are made of the same flesh and blood as they are.
If they don't have gay people here, why is my Scruff going crazy right now?
Big fan? Small fan? Scary stabby fan?
You could say that I'm a big fan. Yes.
Really? That's so surprising because you're not my usual demographic.
Always thought it was a fairy tale.
So to speak. Well, it's true.
Um, I've been a fan since I saw you in the show for which you won your first Tony.
No! You saw Swallow the Moon?
The number at the top of the second act, "The Lady's Improving"? Chills.
That song made me a star.
Uh, Dee Dee, we gotta make haste.
Uh, Miss Allen, I justâ¦ This is a very delicate situation.
I'm asking you and your friends to back off for a few days.
Backing off is exactly what we're not going to do.
You're trying to disarm me with flattery.
It's not going to work, Tom.
We're gonna get dressed up and go to prom and be together in public, not hide anymore.
There's only one thing I'm sure about.

âª I don't want to start a riot âª âª I don't want to blaze a trail âª âª I don't want to be a symbol âª âª Or a cautionary tale âª âª I don't want to be a scapegoat âª âª For people to oppose âª âª What I want is simple âª âª As far as wanting goes âª âª I just want to dance with you âª âª Let the whole world melt away âª âª And dance with you âª âª Who cares what other people say? âª âª And when we're through âª âª No one can convince us âª âª We were wrong âª âª All it takes is you and me âª âª And a song âª âª I don't need a big production âª âª Streamers hanging in the air âª âª I don't need to spend the night with âª âª Confetti in my hair âª âª I don't need a room of people âª âª That I don't really know âª âª I just want to hold you âª âª And never let you go! âª âª I just want to dance with you âª âª Let the whole world melt away âª âª And dance with you âª âª Who cares what other people say? âª âª And when we're throughâ¦ âª âª No one can convince us âª âª We were wrong âª âª All it takes is you and me âª âª And a song âª It's my mom. I gotta go.

Four rooms of varying size to reflect the hierarchy of the company, right?
Now do you have a suite?
No, we don't have any suites.
All the rooms are the same.
Surely you know who I am.
At the very least, I would like a room next to the spa.
We're all gonna get stabbed and stuffed.
No, we don't have any cabins.
It's a Drama Desk. You know what it is.
I vomited in the bus again.
Can I see the hotel doctor, please?
I can't believe it. It's actually you.
You're the guy from Talk to the Hand.
It's on every night at 9:00 after...
Can I have my room, please?
Okay, let's get started. All right?
Okay, Sheldon's working on a venue.
I was misled by my representation.
Mr. Sondheim is not a fan of my Sweeney Todd.
Oh, my Godâ¦ Jesus, Trent, you screwed us.
It's quite rousing, and in a very humane key.
The Godspell kids will back us up, and they have their own costumes.
They'll boo us off the stage.
No, all we need is a simple message that tugs at the heartstrings and a little pageantry.
We have everything we need right here.
What is it? One of those beautiful Antebellum theaters?
Ladies and gentlemen, Truckosaurus, the careating robot dinosaur, will not be your halftime entertainment today.
Instead, we have some guests who've come from New York to sing us a song about intolerance.
I'm Trent Oliver, actor, activistâ¦ and Juilliard graduate.

âª Flowers accept the rain And grow more beautiful âª âª Babies accept their mother's breast âª âª So they can grow strong âª âª I accept that I was born A handsome man âª âª So join with me And sing this acceptance song âª âª Let us accept one another âª âª I know it's truly hard âª âª We're sister and brother âª âª Here's what I learned at Juilliard âª âª Bigotry's not big of me âª âª And it's not big of you âª âª Let's all work together âª âª To make rainbow dreams come true âª Ladies and gentlemen, twotime Tony Award winner, Miss Dee Dee Allen.

I am so sick of failing.
First we kill Trent, then we leave.
Hello, everyoneâ¦ We have some news. Emma and I wanted to be the ones to tell you, thanks to pressure from the state's attorney's office, prom is back on!
Just to be clear, uh, it's not because of youâ¦ Well, maybe it was.
I mean, everybody started freaking out when you got here.
The lawyer might've had legal power, but you really scared people.
Important thing is, it's a victory.
Now you get to go to prom like everybody else!
I was thinking like a vintage tux and some high tops.
I don't know. Does it matter?
And you don't know me, but I am begging you, let me dress you for the prom.
We'll check out the Reba McEntire collection at Kmart, do a little fashion show.
Okay! Oh, can we do it tomorrow?
We can meet at my place.
I have to go and find out if I still have a date.
Sure. I'll go ahead, do a preshop.
Okay? Will you give me a ride in your pickup truck?
Are you saying that because I'm a lesbian, I drive a pickup?
I saw a Big Boy by the highway.
Ooh, they have a gay bar here?
Oh, gay bar. Can't go. I'd be mobbed.
So, it's nice to see Emma smile again.
She's had a rough go of it.
When she came out, her parents, well, they threw her out of the house.
Ohâ¦ Anyway, umâ¦ thank you for helping herâ¦ Or trying to.
Is there a restaurant in town that has plates and cutlery andâ¦ Oh, uh, there's an Applebee's by the mall.
Take me now to this Apples & Bees place.

I mean, she'll be in public, so she can't totally freak out.

âª And no more hiding how we feel anymore âª âª I won't hide if you're by my side âª âª Now that the prom is back âª âª On track âª âª And once we walk into that gym âª âª Handinhand âª âª It's pretty obvious âª âª There's no going back âª âª And that's a promise âª I save all of my money.
I go to New York every summer.
I see as many Broadway shows as I can.
When I run out of money, I second act them.
My point is, I've seen you many, many times.
Ms. Allen, I'm sure that you are very wellversed in the ways of the world and Broadway in particular.
You don't know this town and our values.
No, well, I'm just here advocating on behalf of a young girl whose voice perhaps is not heard by some in the community.
Yes. Well, perhaps you should stick to acting instead of activism.
We didn't mean to make anything worse here.
I appreciate everything that you're doing.
Tell meâ¦ I've never said this before to anyone.
Uh, you know, it can be frustrating, but, uh, at least I have a job.
I'm single. Just putting that out there.
Oh, well, I'm surprised you're surprised.
The two things I'm most passionate about in the world are Broadway musicals and secondary school administration.
I typed that into a dating website once, and a little message popped up that said, "You will have zero matches forever." But you're so smart and you're really goodlooking.
It's just, I look at people like you, and I just think how lucky you are to be surrounded by your people.
I wasn't born on Broadway. You know?
Yeah, I grew up dirt poor.
This wholeâ¦ All this, I invented it.
Yeah. I'm just a smalltown girl andâ¦  I had a big dream.
Single, just putting it out there.
Oh, I think I read about that.
Eddie Sharpe, the talk show host?
I imagine it must be hard being Dee Dee Allen, being a Broadway star.
Sometimes I think I reallyâ¦ I just want to quit.
Because I need you to do what you do.
